meanings.sent1: The bramblings chirped happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I saw a flock of bramblings flying south for the winter.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bramblings refuse to play hide and seek? Because they always stood out with their colorful feathers!
meanings.sent4: The bramblings danced in the sky, their wings painting a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the bramblings made them easy to spot among the leaves.

meanings.definition: Bramblings: plural form of brambling, a type of bird
meanings.sent1: We spotted a group of bramblings pecking at seeds on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The bramblings' nest was hidden among the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The bramblings held a meeting to discuss the best feeding spots in the garden.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the bramblings gathered together, creating a beautiful silhouette.
meanings.sent5: The forest echoed with the cheerful songs of the bramblings.
